context: Post-race — player won their first street race on Harbor Road

lines.text: You cross the overpass line first. Your engine is screaming, your hands are shaking, and the whole world narrows to the sound of your own heartbeat catching up with you.
Behind you, the hatchback's headlights slow. He's not chasing anymore.
You did it. Three hundred dollars richer and a lifetime of doubt lighter. The crowd at the finish is thin, but they saw it. That's what matters.
He pulls up beside you, window down. He's not angry. He's sizing you up — differently now. Like you just became real to him.

lines.speaker: Street Racer
lines.text: That bucket of yours has no business winning that race. Which means you drove the hell out of it.

choices.text: It's not the car. It's the driver.
Good race. You had me sweating at the bridge.

lines.label: racer_responds_cocky
lines.speaker: Street Racer
lines.text: Ha. Big talk from someone whose bumper is held on with zip ties. But hey — tonight? You backed it up.
A few people in the crowd nod. Word travels fast on these streets. You can already feel it — the shift. People are going to remember your name after tonight.

lines.label: racer_responds_respect
lines.speaker: Street Racer
lines.text: Yeah, well... next time I won't brake so early into that last turn. Don't get comfortable.
He says it like a threat, but there's a grin underneath. You just earned something money can't buy in Nova Pacifica — a nod from someone who was here before you.

lines.label: racer_responds_money
lines.speaker: Street Racer
lines.text: Cold. I respect it. Take your cash. You earned it tonight.
He peels a wad of bills from his pocket and tosses them through your window. Six hundred dollars. Not a fortune, but it feels like one.

lines.label: post_win_wrapup
lines.text: The crowd starts to scatter. Sirens somewhere in the distance — probably unrelated, but nobody sticks around to find out. That's the rhythm of Nova Pacifica.

lines.speaker: Street Racer
lines.text: Word of advice? Tonight was small time. If you want real money, real rep — look for the organized runs. Proving Grounds. That's where the scene really lives.
He taps his roof twice and pulls away. His taillights disappear into the city grid. You sit there for a moment, engine ticking, feeling like you just took the first step into something much bigger.
